intro: Deppea serboi, commonly known as the Serbian deppea, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub with small, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white to pink flowers. It is often found in forested areas and along stream banks, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species with ecological and botanical significance.
